reviews.review_msg: The prof made a mistake and deleted the original discussion groups, thus "losing" my discussion assignment, then dared to mark it as "incomplete". I tried contacting the prof and TA about this, and neither has responded. My work is still "lost" and "incomplete" even though I submitted it. This class is so messy; if you can, avoid this course.
trash course and a doodoo prof. Absolute waste of time. Couldn't be bothered with this course if it weren't for my B-Hum requirements. Terrible experience

Took this course as an elective and GPA booster. The TAs do mark tough but if you put in the work you'll at least get A-. Currently on a co-op and this course was pretty light, as in nothing to study for. But very writing intensive, so be sure to brush up on your writing skills and pay attention to course terms. Grading is very vague though...
Worst class I've taken in a while

Grading is tough depending on the ta. This class took more of my time than my other main classes. Out of the 5 assignments so far only 2 have been marked. The readings are mainly random history facts and less about how to analyze music.
The worst class I've ever taken.

Honestly avoid this class only if u have this prof. There is no feedback given and when you question a grade, in return, you get an egoistical response. The material has a vague description but marks are cut off without reason. Comments are not helpful and do not indicate what was amiss. Overall, the most disrespectful and rude prof I've ever had.

This course should be a writing course. Expect ~7 assignments/exams with ~800 words. Everyone I know received the same 3 marks (B/B+/A-) for every assignment, so it may be impossible to get higher or lower. TAs got my name wrong and seem to not care. LOTS of reading. but is usually interesting. But Arne is hilarious: Genshin music was on our final.

Material is all taught through Canvas readings

Quizzes are short/easy, all with 2 attempts

Assignments are all written with modestly long word counts

Finals the same as assignment

This class was fun but I only recommend it if you truly appreciate music across many genres, its applications in media, as well as the contexts they are performed in.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Why did he think assigning NUMEROUS group projects for an ONLINE class is a good idea? The assignments have very vague instructions, yet are graded very harshly. TA feedback would say you did a great job but proceed to give a B-. Certain criteria like "creativity" on a formal analysis paper make no sense.
Incredibly callous and ableist, typical music prof.

This should be an easy online course, but the delivery (reading walls of text on canvas) was extremely boring. Content itself was not difficult to understand, but assignments were returned late or not at all (even after the strike was over), and there was NO feedback or rubric to see why marks were taken off. Overall frustrating and a waste of time

this course seems easy at first and claims to be intro level content that anyone can do however it is not. TAs give no feedback on assignments and are harsh graders, assignments dont relate to lecture content and lectures are written out and super long and dont cover much info
Unfortunate.

Lectures are just paragraphs of reading on canvas, assignments have nothing to do with lecture content. Assignment instructions are super vague, and TA does not give clarification nor good feedback. Mediocre course where you have to teach yourself the material.
Amazing prof - super easy course, even with the group projects/assignments. Would definitely take again.

Has some fun group projects and his short videos were sometimes entertaining. This course has a lot of reading to do every week. You can do the weekly reading and quizzes whenever you like so you can be ahead of schedule (I was always 1 week ahead without a problem). Overall great course just a lot of boring reading to get through.

This class had so much work while there were no lectures whatsoever. We had weekly group assignments and they were marked insanely hard. Quizzes are were short yet confusing. We got put into random groups at the start of the course so if you get stuck with a bad group, then that sucks :/ Overall, I wouldn't recommend this course.

I was told this was an easy GPA booster but jokes on that. This class had so much extra work. Weekly group work and quizzes. You don't get to pick your group so if you are stuck in a bad group it sucks. Would not recommend taking this class. More work than my 4th-year classes.

Lectures were very confusing and did not help at all. Biweekly quizzes and assignments were tough as well. The first few assignments were fine but then they got much harder. Quizzes were confusing as well. Overall, I would not recommend taking this class.

Arne was a good professor and responds to your emails very quick. Course was mainly focussed on the individual and group assignments and TA marked pretty hard. Quizzes, midterm and final aren't worth much but it's still good to do them. Sometimes there's too much due at once so make sure you stay on top of the coursework.

Took this online. No lectures, just readings (1 hr a week) and biweekly quizzes. Quizzes can be tough, 5 questions. Though open book, you need to understand the content of the course. Total of 6 papers (bi-weekly) including final (take-home), though they are 500-1000 words each. TA was great (marked easy), took course as elective.
Lectures are confusing, just to go wikipedia. Last few quizzes are a guessing game. Assignments are good sizes, but grading seems to change with the flip of a switch, so watch out.

I took the online class and let's say he put all the lectures he does in person into writing, and this is music we're talking about so if you don't have a background in it, you're gonna be completely lost. He also wasn't approachable at all and had a weird tone in his emails. Not recommended.

He is very knowledgeable, though his surprise quizzes can be very difficult if you have not done the readings. If you have any interest in contemporary Classical music then his lectures are perfect for you. Helped me discover Phillip Glass and i will forever be grateful for that.

Although his lectures may be a little dry, he was very knowledgeable about the material covered in the class and clearly seemed interested in what he was teaching. Make sure to take clear notes as he does not upload lecture slides online. Pop quizzes may be difficult if you dont keep up with the readings on canvas.

Artistic differences, let's say. If I put a lot of work into something and was proud of what I'd achieved artistically, I didn't do any better than if I just submitted crap to get the assignment done. I definitely learned in this course, but I didn't really learn what I wanted to and I left with absolutely no further interest in electronic music.
Great course, doesn't have a textbook and his notes were very well articulated. He answers emails within a day and is extremely helpful.
very knowledgeable, never went to get extra help cause his lectures are well taught. Explains clearly. Music is not my major, but I liked his class better than the classes in my major.

Prof. seems like a very nice guy however doesn't like to stray from the ppt. script which makes the 2 hour class long and uninspiring.  He is a very knowledgeable guy and it would be more relevant to have some interaction with him however he is NOT approachable at all and seems intimidated by the class environment.  Assignment structure is great!!

Arne is passionate about music and it really shows in his lectures. He seems quite shy and is better at answering questions one on one instead of during class. It seems to throw him off a bit when asked mid lecture. Good class, not for a slacker though as there are many assignments. If you love or are interested in music, this class is great.

Attending class is pointless, as he does not take attendance and posts all lecture notes online. Doesn't elaborate on PPT slides, which are phrased awkwardly. Doesn't answer questions well. Difficult marker who doesn't give adequate reasoning for poor grades. Won't even know your name in a class of <30. Huge disappointment.

Bad, bad. Just reads his notes. No clear interaction with students and an avoidance of doing anything that will help us understand the material. Painfully shy and hasn't learned how to get better of 15 years. How come?

Prof was approachable and was open to questions outside of class. Lectures frequently  rushed through due to amount of material. Does not require attendance(aware that most people use the notes he provides from when the course was distance)but will answer you with 'it was lecture' if you email covered questions. Not a hard course. Obsessed with Mac
No one can teach this course better than him. His explanation is very very clear. He doesn't just read off the notes, he actually helps us to understand.An interesting course!
The class is easy and but a lot work. Assignments are hard because TA and Prof dont help. Labs are completely useless so is Prof and TA. Dont take this unless it is required.

The grading is very subjective. There is no practices for assignments so you never know what the grader is expecting.(there is a TA that helps grading) I think the course material can be more intersting if taught by a different person. I think he is hard to talk to or ask questions.

Worst prof i have had in SFU. Will not ever take a class with him again. Emailed him many times with questions but the answer is always the same. "I said it in class" or check online notes. In lecture he just reads the webct notes. Not very helpful and he is very cocky. Low attendance is for lecture because he cant teach.
Who knew electroacoustic music could be so interesting?

Dont get Y ppl say he is a sweet guy.Emailed him a couple times inquiring course material.Yes,he would reply u fast but in a COCKY way.I find dis class VERY BORING.He read da lecture notes as if readin a book.He got da weirdest musical taste ever,he like weird sounds.WILL NEVER TAKE ANOTHER CLASS W/ HIM AGAIN..W/ SUCH RUDE ATTITUDE 2WARD STUDENTS.
Teaches like he's teaching high school. Very clear, but timid and not very inspiring... Sweet guy, though...
took the on-line version of the course.  Not too difficult, explains the material well, not bad but didn't blow my mind.

Highly recommend taking one of Arne's classes,he responds very quickly to emails, always very pleasant and allows students to be creative. His assignments are fair, though his marking can be tough,i recommend having knowledge of music before taking the class. Also is open to criticism.
Great prof; very helpful, interested and interesting, and gives enjoyable assignments.  Always willing to help.
Sweet class, good guy, easy all around fun and fair class
He is so nice and hard working ^^
Think he's a little shy :) Knowledgeable, helpful, extremely hard working.
One of the best and most underrated profs out there.  This guy is so humble!
